scenario: An elite university department is conducting a hiring negotiation where administration, faculty committees, and candidates must navigate budget constraints and competing offers while balancing transparency and confidentiality.
task: Formulate a hiring strategy that optimizes candidate selection while adhering to budget limits and negotiating competing offers effectively. Agents must share information selectively to reach a consensus without compromising their positions.

agents.name: Department Chair
agents.role: Leads the hiring process and represents the department's interests.
responsibilities: Set the hiring budget and allocate resources accordingly.
Negotiate salary offers with candidates based on internal equity.
Ensure alignment of candidate selection with departmental strategic goals.
Manage communication between candidates and faculty committees.
Advocate for the best fit for the department while respecting faculty input.

agents.name: Faculty Committee Member
agents.role: Represents faculty interests and ensures candidates meet academic standards.
responsibilities: Evaluate candidates based on academic qualifications and fit.
Provide input on salary offers based on market standards.
Ensure transparency in the hiring process while advocating for faculty preferences.
Collaborate with the department chair to align candidate selection with faculty needs.
Engage in discussions about the strategic direction of the department.

agents.name: Candidate
agents.role: Potential hire seeking the best offer that aligns with personal and professional goals.
responsibilities: Negotiate salary and benefits with the university.
Research departmental culture and strategic goals.
Communicate personal and professional expectations clearly.
Evaluate competing offers and make informed decisions.
Maintain confidentiality about other offers during negotiations.

deliverable: A comprehensive hiring plan that includes salary offers, candidate evaluations, and alignment with departmental goals.

public: All candidates evaluated on the same criteria
private: Candidate information regarding other offers must be kept confidential

penalties_utilities: Penalties are expressed as utility losses (e.g., -300, -250, -200, -150, -100). Utilities are expressed as gains (e.g., +150, +100, +80, +50).
